DataElement.preferredName: Breast Carcinoma Transplantation Time Recurrent Disease Chemosensitivity Type
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A description of the sensitivity to chemotherapy of the recurrent breast cancer at the time of transplantation.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Breast Carcinoma Transplantation Time Recurrent Disease
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A carcinoma arising from the breast, most commonly the terminal ductal-lobular unit. It is the most common malignant tumor in females. Risk factors include country of birth, family history, menstrual and reproductive history, fibrocystic disease and epithelial hyperplasia, exogenous estrogens, contraceptive agents, and ionizing radiation. The vast majority of breast carcinomas are adenocarcinomas (ductal or lobular). Breast carcinoma spreads by direct invasion, by the lymphatic route, and by the blood vessel route. The most common site of lymph node involvement is the axilla._The grafting of tissues from one individual to another or place to place within a single individual._The continuum of experience in which events pass from the future through the present to the past._the return of a sign, symptom, or disease after a remission.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A carcinoma arising from the breast, most commonly the terminal ductal-lobular unit.  Breast carcinoma may affect both females and males.  It is the most common malignant tumor and the leading cause of carcinoma death in women.  Risk factors include country of birth, family history, menstrual and reproductive history, fibrocystic disease and epithelial hyperplasia, exogenous estrogens, contraceptive agents, and ionizing radiation.  The widespread use of mammography has contributed in the detection of very early cancerous lesions (less than 2mm in diameter).  The vast majority of breast carcinomas are adenocarcinomas (ductal or lobular).  Breast carcinoma spreads by direct invasion, by the lymphatic route, and by the blood vessel route.  The most common site of lymph node involvment is the axilla.  Breast carcinomas infrequently occur in males (particularly elderly individuals and patients with Klinefelter's syndrome).  The therapy of breat carcinoma includes surgery, radiation therapy, hormonal therapy and chemotherapy, depending on the type and extend of the disease. --2002

Concepts.definition: A carcinoma arising from the breast, most commonly the terminal ductal-lobular unit. It is the most common malignant tumor in females. Risk factors include country of birth, family history, menstrual and reproductive history, fibrocystic disease and epithelial hyperplasia, exogenous estrogens, contraceptive agents, and ionizing radiation. The vast majority of breast carcinomas are adenocarcinomas (ductal or lobular). Breast carcinoma spreads by direct invasion, by the lymphatic route, and by the blood vessel route. The most common site of lymph node involvement is the axilla.

Concepts.definition: Transference of a tissue or organ within an individual, between individuals of the same species, or between individuals of different species.
The continuum of experience in which events pass from the future through the present to the past.
The return of a disease after a period of remission.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Specification of human conditions relevant to cancer. This includes observations, test results, history, and other concepts relevant to characterization of human cancer-related conditions. Non-neoplastic conditions of interest are also included.

ReferenceDocuments.name: BRIDG mapping path for CDE:2677074
ReferenceDocuments.description: PerformedDiagnosis [primary] > AssessedResultRelationship > PerformedObservation [assessment] > PerformedClinicalInterpretation.value [assessment] WHERE PerformedDiagnosis.value = "breast cancer" AND PerformedDiagnosis.diseaseStatusCode = "relapse" AND PerformedDiagnosis > PerformedObservation.dateRange IS LESS THAN PerformedSubstanceAdministration.dateRange AND PerformedSubstanceAdministration > DefinedSubstanceAdministration.nameCode = "Administer Hematopoietic Cell Product{ Transplantation} AND PerformedObservation [assessment] > DefinedObservation.name = "Assess Chemotherpay Sensitivity"
